alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 2:59AM PST until March 10 at 7:45AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Kern, Kings and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 600 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Visalia, Tulare, Porterville, Hanford, Corcoran, Orosi, Earlimart, Lindsay, Farmersville, Exeter, Woodlake, Woodville, Poplar-Cotton Center, Ivanhoe, Strathmore, East Porterville, Cutler, East Orosi, Three Rivers and Tipton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
